contextId.information: This nominal adjective can be stated as an adjective. AT: "those who are poor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
"refuse to do evil deeds and choose to do good deeds" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
contextId.quote: refuse the evil and choose the good

contextId.information: "refuse to do evil deeds and choose to do good deeds." Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:isa:07:13|7:15]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
contextId.quote: refuse the evil and choose the good

contextId.information: These phrases refer to people who have these qualities. AT: "poor people ... humble people ... wicked people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
contextId.quote: the poor ... the humble ... the wicked

contextId.information: These phrases refer to people who have these qualities. AT: "wicked people ... proud people ... ruthless people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
contextId.quote: the wicked ... the proud ... the ruthless

contextId.information: This is a nominal adjective. AT: "ruthless people" or "those who are ruthless" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This can be reworded so that the nominal adjective "dead" is expressed as the verb "have died." AT: "Your people who have died will live again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This refers to people who act rashly and people who stutter. AT: "The rash person ... the stuttering person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

"The fool" refers to foolish people. Also, "folly" and "evil" may be expressed as adjectives. AT: "For the foolish person says foolish things and his heart plans evil things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: For the fool speaks folly, and his heart plans evil

contextId.information: "The hungry" refers to hungry people. They are hungry because they have empty stomachs. AT: "the hungry person have an empty stomach" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to a person who deceives others. AT: "The deceptive person's" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

"The blind" refers to people who are blind. They are referred to by their "eyes" to emphasize their healing. AT: "blind people will see" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: the eyes of the blind will see

contextId.information: "The living" refers to people who are alive. AT: "in the land where people are alive" or "in this world where people are alive" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
contextId.quote: in the land of the living

contextId.information: To "ransom" means to "rescue." This refers to people whom Yahweh has rescued. AT: "Those whom Yahweh has rescued" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

The word "wicked" refers to wicked people. Yahweh speaks of wicked people no longer sinning as if they were to stop walking along a path that they had been traveling. AT: "Let wicked people change the way they live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Let the wicked leave his path
